description: The IC3 Key Applications exam and certification is designed to demonstrate a candidate’s basic skill with the most common features found in business productivity programs such as Microsoft Office Word 2010, Excel 2010, PowerPoint 2010 and even Access 2010.  The show is to help the candidate, regardless of computing skills to gain an understanding and a basic working knowledge of these applications.  Other goals you’ll see in the show includes obtaining apps and understanding the terminology surrounding the use of these applications regardless of whether you’re using a desktop computer, tablet or a smart phone.
name: IC3 Key Applications
subtitle: Global Standard 5

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Ronnie explore the world of working with applications. They start with how to obtain applications as well as identifying various types of common applications.
episodes.title: Work with Applications

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Ronnie continue their look into working with applications as well as identifying various types of common applications. They also discuss determining the requirements of applications and the uninstall process.
episodes.title: Work with Applications Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Cherokee introduce you to common productivity applications. Ronnie demonstrates how to easily access and launch Microsoft Word (a test editing program) and other products such as Powerpoint, Excel, and Access. He also shows how to navigate throughout the program and execute functions such as save and save as. Although the majority of this episode shows Microsoft Word just remember a lot of the core features are the same but to master these productivity skills you will need to practice.
episodes.title: Work with Office 2010

episodes.description: In this episode you will be introduced to Microsoft Word and will learn how to maneuver and format different styles of documents. Ronnie demonstrates how to modify text fonts, sizes, paragraph formats, create bulleted lists, and modify indentations and line spacing. You will also see how to create and utilize page breaks within your documents.
episodes.title: Work with Word 2010

episodes.description: This is a continuation of exploring Microsoft Word. Ronnie and Cherokee pick up with section breaks, modifying paper size and orientation, customizing margins, numbering pages, creating headers and footers in addition to creating multiple columns. You will also see how to insert and format photos and images within a document. Learning how to crop, resize and text wrap a picture will help take your document generating  skills to the next level.
episodes.title: Work with Word 2010 Part 2

episodes.description: One of the many productivity applications highlighted in this series is Microsoft Excel. In this episode Ronnie and Cherokee show you how to work with workbooks and worksheets. You will also become familiar with the basic layout of rows, columns, and cells. You will see how to manipulate data within the cells, including being introduced to formulas.
episodes.title: Work with Microsoft Excel

episodes.description: This episode is a continuation of Microsoft Excel. You will diver deeper into formulas and functions. Be cognizant of the order of operations  whilst developing your cell formulas and utilize cell reference for swift navigation.  You will also learn how to create tables and graphs.
episodes.title: Work with Microsoft Excel Part 2

episodes.description: This episode introduces you to Microsoft PowerPoint. If you can get past the zany concept of the PowerPoint shown in this episode you will learn quite a bit about the software. Ronnie demonstrates how to create, insert, delete, reorganize and customize slides. You will also see how deigning the Master slide to simultaneously push design elements to multiple slides.
episodes.title: Work with Microsoft PowerPoint

episodes.description: This episode is a continuation of Microsoft PowerPoint. Ronnie and Cherokee expand on the concepts introduced in the previous show. You will see how to create text boxes, tables, insert elements such as pictures, video and audio clips. You will also see how to add some animations to your presentation.
episodes.title: Work with Microsoft PowerPoint Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Cherokee explore Microsoft Access, a relational database management system. You will learn what the software does in terms of linking data between tables. Ronnie demonstrates how to create a database as well as tables of data. He also provides real life examples of how one may use this software to benefit.
episodes.title: Work with Microsoft Access 2010

episodes.description: This is a continuation of working with Microsoft Access 2010. You will learn how to establish the relationships between different tables using the software. With the large amount of information contained within some databases it may become difficult to search for the individual data entries. Ronnie demonstrates how to create a query to sole this issue.
episodes.title: Work with Microsoft Access 2010 Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode you will learn how to generate a report based on the information within the database. You may not be satisfied with the generic template the report wizard runs by default. Ronnie demonstrates how to create and manipulate a report to customize the look.
episodes.title: Work with Microsoft Access 2010 Part 3
